Text: Compensation for the above claims (for residents of England, Scotland and Wales) is handled by the Insolvency Service. It will be the responsibility of the appointed liquidator to inform employees of their rights and send the appropriate forms giving advice on what allowances they can claim. There is a cap on redundancy payments, set at £525 a week for each element of the claim (arrears of pay, holiday pay, redundancy etc).
Cause: Compensation for the above claims (for residents of England, Scotland and Wales) is handled by the Insolvency Service.
Effect: There is a cap on redundancy payments, set at £525 a week for each element of the claim (arrears of pay, holiday pay, redundancy etc).
Sentence: <e1>Compensation for the above claims (for residents of England, Scotland and Wales) is handled by the Insolvency Service.</e1> It will be the responsibility of the appointed liquidator to inform employees of their rights and send the appropriate forms giving advice on what allowances they can claim. <e2>There is a cap on redundancy payments, set at £525 a week for each element of the claim (arrears of pay, holiday pay, redundancy etc).</e2>
